unit_learning_outcomes.description: Apply nonparametric function estimation approaches to estimate density function, regression function and quantile regression function.
Evaluate the performance of nonparametric curve estimators by applying Monte-Carlo  and bootstrapping methods.
Produce estimates of bias and variance along with confidence interval by applying Monte-Carlo and  bootstrappping methods.
Apply EM algorithm to deal with missing data.
Use Matlab and R for parametric and nonparametric estimation problems.
Derive and explore Maximum Likelihood and Bayesian estimators.

non_scheduled_learning_activities.description: Work in the iLearn online space
Review the discipline specific content delivered in or needed for classes.

assessments.description: Students will write code and interpret output in order to answer statistical questions. Students may work on the assignment on their own computers or using University resources.
Students will write code and interpret output in order to answer statistical questions. Students may work on the assignment on their own computers or using University resources.
Formal invigilated examination testing the learning outcomes of the unit.

data.unit_offering_text:
Session 1, Weekday attendance, North Ryde
Session 1, Special circumstances
data.description: This unit offers students the opportunity to study some modern computational methods in statistics. The first half of the unit covers maximum likelihood computations, penalised likelihood, missing data and the EM algorithm. The second half considers Kernel density estimation, Kernel regression, quantile regression and inferences using Monte-Carlo and bootstrapping methods. State-of-the-art computing softwares are used.
data.title: Modern Computational Statistical Methods

title: Modern Computational Statistical Methods
